text: The giant barb (Catlocarpio siamensis), also called a Siamese giant carp, is the biggest cyprinid in the world. It is found in the Mae Klong, Mekong, and Chao Phraya Rivers. Due to overfishing and habitat loss, it is classified as critically endangered by the IUCN Red List. == Description == === Physical appearance === One of the largest freshwater fish, giant barbs can reach 3 m (9.8 ft). The world record for its weight was when an angler caught a giant barb that weighed a whopping 105 kg and 231 lb. === Distribution/Habitat === Giant barbs live in the edges of large rivers and youngsters are found in tributaries and swamps. == Related pages == * Tor putitora == References == Category:IUCN Red List critically endangered species Category:Cypriniformes Category:Freshwater fish Category:Ray-finned fish Category:Animals of Asia Category:Thailand Category:National symbols of Cambodia == Other websites ==
title: Giant barb
